title: Formex Polypropylene
content: Formex materials can be converted into custom shapes and sizes per customer specifications, and are perfect for electrical barrier and insulation applications. Formex is composed of flame-retardant polypropylene that prevents electrically charged components from arcing, protecting the users, equipment, and maintenance personnel.
description: SRP provides custom fabrication and converting services for electrical insulation applications that require Formex materials.

seo.title: Formex Polypropylene
seo.description: SRP provides custom fabrication and converting services for electrical insulation applications that require Formex materials.

blocks.title: Formex Polypropylene Features
blocks.content:
• UL 94V-0 Flame Class Rating meets global standards for safety
  • Non-hygroscopic (ultra-low <0.06% moisture absorption)

blocks.title: Benefits
blocks.content:
• Excellent dielectric strength shields against electrical surges
  • Chemical resistance maintains mechanical and electrical properties
  • Superior scoring, folding, and bending capabilities—parts do not split or crack
  • Competitive pricing

blocks.title: Applications
blocks.content:
• EMI Shielding
  • Flame Barrier
  • Cloud data centers
  • Industrial controls
  • LED lighting
  • Electrical power distribution
  • Consumer electronics
  • Major appliances
  • Medical electronics
  • Information technology
  • Telecommunications

materials.title: Plastic & Film
materials.content: SRP Converts A Variety Of Thin Plastic And Film Products to your custom requirements.SRP has the capabilities to convert custom plastic and film into gaskets, seals, and insulators for a variety of industries and applications.Plastic and film materials generally have good aging properties and will not deteriorate over time. These materials are strong and flexible having a high tensile strength, flexibility, durability and dimensional stability. Premium plastics and film products have low shrinkage, low moisture absorption, good dielectric properties and high thermal resistance.SRP typically converts plastic and film materials ranging from .001” to .125” thick. However, when utilizing our waterjet, we can cut plastic up to .250” thick and maintaining tight tolerances.Plastic and film materials are cut per our customers specifications, and can be supplied with a pressure sensitive adhesive.Common Plastic MaterialsFormex™ PolypropylenePOREX® PTFETeflon® PTFEPolyethylene (PET)Common Film MaterialsKapton® PolyimideMelinex® Polyester (PET)Mylar® Polyester (PET)Lexan™ PolycarbonateValox™ PolybutyleneRigid Vinyl PVC (Polyvinyl Chloride)  SRP: Building Relationships through Converting Solutions Since 1951We provide our customers with everything from material sampling and product prototyping to full manufacturing, packaging, and delivery. We provide value to our customers by delivering exceptional customer service, engineering solutions, and quality products to meet their every need.
materials.description: SRP fabricates custom plastic and film gaskets, seals, and insulators for a wide variety of industries and applications.
